result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph N Berry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay plus mandatory costs, assessments, DV surcharges and surcharges by 12-30-15 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection. 

Defendant to have no contact with Sandra W. during the entire length of the sentence.

Any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance or alcohol forfeits the release privileges.

Court denies defense motion for expungement.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph N Berry

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph N Berry in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.    Upon inquiry of the Court, State advises they have complied with victim notification. Statements by counsel, Sandra W. and defendant.

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 4 months at the House of Correction with Huber for actual work and 65 days credit; pay plus mandatory costs, assessments, DV surcharges and surcharges by 12-30-15 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

COURT ORDERS:
- defendant to have no contact with Sandra W. during the entire length of the sentence.   Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance or alcohol forfeits the release privileges. 

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Court denies defense motion for expungement.

Defendant Joseph N Berry in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Joseph N Berry in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Case heard for Br. 04.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to Count 1 and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1 as charged in the Complaint and enters a judgment of conviction.  

On motion of the State, Court orders Count 2 DISMISSED and read-in for sentencing purposes.
Due to branch 4 in trial, case transferred to branch 44 for Plea Hearing.   mld
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA AND SENTENCING IN BRANCH 4.
Defendant Joseph N Berry in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Joseph N Berry not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense withdraws bail motion.  On motion of the State, Court joins this case with defendant's other two pending cases 15CM581 and 15CM826 currently scheduled for jury trial on 6-10-15.  Jury trial scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Attorney Alexis B Stewart in court.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Joseph N Berry not in court, defendant in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Upon the request of defense counsel, who was unaware of today's proceedings, the Bail / Bond hearing and Status Conference in Branch 4 at 8:30 am, is rescheduled to 4-20-2015 at 1:30 am.    mld

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SANDRA W.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Joseph N Berry in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Defendant Joseph N Berry in custody.  Lovell Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Status conference scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
